summary: The SNAP Reform and Upward Mobility Act of 2025 (H.R. 2407) focuses on reforming the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). Key provisions include improving poverty measurement, adding work requirements for beneficiaries, establishing state matching funds for program administration, tightening eligibility criteria, increasing compliance with fraud investigations, and modifying regulations on Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) cards. The bill also reauthorizes high-risk retail food stores, mandates state activity reports, and allows states to retain recaptured funds for fraud investigations.
